comments.en: The Heritage Risk Assessment Ontology (HeRO, https://w3id.org/sirius/ontology/hero) is an OWL 2 DL ontology that aims to provide a framework for the formal description of risk assessment activities related to heritage.

abstract.value: The Heritage Risk Assessment Ontology (HeRO, https://w3id.org/sirius/ontology/hero) is an OWL 2 DL ontology that aims to provide a framework for the formal description of risk assessment activities related to heritage.

bibliographicCitation.value: Barzaghi, S. (2023). Heritage Risk Assessment Ontology. https://w3id.org/sirius/ontology/hero.

comment.en: An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).
A quantifiable aspect of some entity, that expresses a more precise and standardised evaluation of it, based on assigning numerical values or metrics to some specific attributes.

comment.undefined:
A concept is a Social Object. 
The classifies relation relates concepts to entities at some time, but time can only be expressed in the alternative pattern: timeindexedclassification.
Any physical, social, or mental process, event, or state.

comment.en: The size of the expected loss of value in the whole asset affected by the risk.
A dimension that refers to the historical context, significance, and evolution of an asset
The dimension referring to the aesthetic qualities associated with an asset.
A dimension that involves the application of research, documentation, and analysis techniques to understand, preserve, and interpret an asset.
A dimension that considers the cultural and social context of an asset, including its role in shaping identity, community values, and social practices.
A facet of an asset that contributes to the overall understanding and assessment of its value.

The likelihood or probability of a specific risk event occurring within a given period. It quantifies how often a particular risk is expected to materialize and helps assess the regularity or recurrence of the risk.
A type of risk that occurs less often than approximately once every 100 years.
A type of risk that occurs many times per century.
A type of risk that can occur continuously or intermittently.
A conceptualization used to classify a risk according to its type of occurrence.

comment.undefined:
A view on a set of entities. It can be seen as a 'relational context', reifying a relation.
For example, a PlanExecution is a context including some actions executed by agents according to certain parameters and expected tasks to be achieved from a Plan; a DiagnosedSituation is a context of observed entities that is interpreted on the basis of a Diagnosis, etc.
Situation is also able to represent reified n-ary relations, where isSettingFor is the top-level relation for all binary projections of the n-ary relation. If used in a transformation pattern for n-ary relations, the designer should take care of:
- creating only one situation for each instance of an n-ary relation, otherwise the 'identification constraint' (Calvanese et al., IJCAI 2001) could be violated
- adding an 'exact cardinality' restriction corresponding to the arity of the n-ary relation, otherwise the designer would actually represent a polymorphic relation.

comment.en: A quality that represents the perceived significance or importance assigned to an asset.
An activity that involves the identification of values that contribute to the perceived importance of an asset.
An activity that involves the identification of risks to understand their nature, causes, and consequences with respect to an asset.

comment.undefined:
Any region in a dimensional space (a dimensional space is a maximal Region), which can be used as a value for a quality of an Entity . For example, TimeInterval, SpaceRegion, PhysicalAttribute, Amount, SocialAttribute are all subclasses of Region. 
Regions are not data values in the ordinary knowledge representation sense; in order to get patterns for modelling data, see the properties: representsDataValue and hasDataValue

comment.en: The quantified extension of a risk, encompassing the overall impact and severity associated with it if it were to occur.

comment.undefined:
Any Region in a dimensional space that aims at representing time.
It should be used when you want to talk about time as an object having some characteristics.

comment.en: A contextual parameter representing the socio-cultural environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter representing the legal environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter representing the economic environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter representing the administrative environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter representing the physical environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter representing the political environment of the heritage asset.
A contextual parameter used in an observation about an asset during an assessment activity.

comment.undefined: Any physical, social, or mental object, or substance

comment.en: The size of the expected loss of value in each part of the asset affected by the risk.
A conceptual category used as a basis for evaluating an asset during a risk assessment activity.

comment.undefined: The parameters of an observation describe the context and content of the observation. For example in a medical context an observation of a patient may contain a set of symptoms, that are the parameters of that observation.

comment.en: A layer that encapsulates the broader area or property on which the heritage asset is situated.
A layer that encapsulates the broadest space in which the heritage asset is considered.
A layer that encapsulates the entire building that houses the heritage asset.
The immediate surroundings or foundation upon which an asset relies.
A layer that encapsulates the interior space where the heritage asset is located.
A layer that encapsulate the first, closest movable space to the asset.
A conceptualization used to classify a risk threatening an asset on the basis of the spatial context in which the asset exists.
The possibility of a loss of value to an asset.
A situation consisting in the assessment of the risks related to an asset.

comment.undefined: A Situation that is explicitly indexed at some time for at least one entity.

comment.en: An observation about an asset during an assessment activity.
An activity that involves the examination of the contextual information of an asset.

comment.undefined: A specific situation where some thing is observed with respect ot a set of parameters.

labels.en: The surroundings and environment in which an asset is located.

comment.en: An aspect that pertains to the purpose and use of an asset.
An aspect that involves the material composition and integrity of an asset.
An aspect that involves the surroundings and environment in which an asset is located.
An aspect that encompasses the intangible and emotional aspects associated with an asset.
An aspect that refers to the physical characteristics and appearance of an asset.
A facet of the context that contributes to the overall understanding and assessment of the asset value.
An activity that involves the quantification of risks to understand their magnitude and potential impact with respect to an asset.
A document.
An agent of deterioration representing mechanical damage resulting from handling, transport, and vibration.
An agent of deterioration that includes the natural tendency for ordered systems to fall apart over time.
An agent of deterioration representing the presence of biological agents, such as insects, rodents, and microorganisms.
An agent of deterioration representing different forms of electromagnetic radiation.
An agent of deterioration representing deliberate acts of theft, vandalism, or destruction done by humans.
An agent of deterioration representing a situation in which the ambient temperature deviates from the optimal or specified range.
An agent of deterioration representing the destruction of an asset due to properties of fire, such as heat, flames, or smoke.
An agent of deterioration representing the presence of substances or contaminants introduced into the environment.
An agent of deterioration representing the situation in which the level of humidity in the environment deviates from the optimal or specified range.
An agent of deterioration representing the damage that can occur through leaks, flooding, or high humidity levels.
A conceptualization used to classify a risk threatening an asset, made from the perspective of the asset itself.

comment.undefined: A relation between entities and regions, e.g. 'the number of wheels of that truck is 12'.
The start date of a time interval.

comment.en: The relationship between a identification activity and a risk that is being identified.

comment.undefined: The end date of a time interval.

A relation between entities and situations, e.g. 'this morning I've prepared my coffee with a new fantastic Arabica' (i.e.: (an amount of) a new fantastic Arabica hasSetting the preparation of my coffee this morning).

comment.en: The relationship between a risk that is being analysed and an analysis activity.
The relationship between a Situation and something it is the setting for.
A property that assigns a textual description to something.
A property that assigns a datetime to a Observation.
The relationship between a Time indexed situation and something contextualised in it.
The relationship between an Observation and a Parameter.
The relationship between a Parameter and an Observation.
A relationship between a risk and another concept that may classify it, such as an agent of deterioration, a layer, or a type.
The relationship between an analysis activity and a measure considered during the analysis.
A property that assigns a estimate value for the most likely case scenario to a measure.
The relationship between an observation and an assessment activity.
A property that assigns a estimate value to a measure.
The relationship between a value assessment and an asset value that is being assessed.
The relationship between an assessment activity and an observation occurring during said activity.
A property that assigns a value percentage to an asset which has been assigned a value in a value description.
The relationship between an Observation and an entity it observes.

comment.undefined: A datatype property that encodes values from xsd:date (or any other date-related xsd datatype) for a TimeInterval; a same TimeInterval can have more than one date value: begin date, end date, date at which the interval holds, as well as dates expressed in different formats: xsd:gYear, xsd:dateTime, etc.

comment.en: A relationship between a risk and a type.

comment.undefined: A datatype property that encodes values for a Region, e.g. a float for the Region Height.

comment.en: The relationship between an analysis and a risk that is being analysed.
The relationship between a measure and an analysis activity.
The relationship between an assessment activity and the entity described in that assessment, such as an asset.
A relationship between a risk and an agent of deterioration.

comment.undefined: A relation between entities and regions, e.g. 'the color of my car is red'.

comment.en: The relationship between an entity and a Time indexed situation contextualising it.
The relationship between a risk that is being identified and a identification activity.

comment.undefined: A relation between a Concept and an Entity, e.g. 'John is considered a typical rude man'; your last concert constitutes the achievement of a lifetime; '20-year-old means she's mature enough'.

comment.en: The relationship between an entity, such as a criterion, and a assessment activity assessing it.
The relationship between something and a Document that documents it.
A property that assigns a numerical estimate to quantify an asset value.
The relationship between an entity and an Observation.
The relationship between a Event and a Object participating in it.
The relationship between an Object and an Event it participates in.
The relationship between an agent and an assessment activity.
A relationship between a risk and a layer.
The relationship between an Observation and a Parameter.
The relationship between a Time interval and a Time indexed situation.
The relationship between an asset value that is being assessed and a value assessment.
The relationship between a document and an entity documented by it.
A relationship between an observation happening during a contextualisation activity and a contextual parameter that is being observed as part of the context.
The relationship between a Event and a Object participating in it.
A property that assigns a estimate value for the best case scenario to a measure.
The relationship between an assessment activity and a participant that takes part in it.
A relationship between an assessment activity and an entity assessed by it, such as a criterion.

comment.undefined: A relation between a Concept and an Entity, e.g. the Role 'student' classifies a Person 'John'.

comment.en: The relationship between a Time indexed situation and a Time interval.
A property that assigns a datetime value to an observation.
The relationship between an Object and an Event it participates in.
A property that assigns a estimate value for the worst case scenario to a measure.
The relationship between the entity, such as an asset, and an assessment activity assessing it.
